chapter.title: Extensions
chapter.para: Although, Disnix makes the deployment of a distributed system more convenient and offers features to make this process reiable and efficient, some extensions have been developed to make this process more convenient.

section.title: DisnixWebService
section.para: In some cases other communication protocols are desired to use in order to connect to remote machines, except SSH. The DisnixWebService is a package that contains a SOAP interface for deployment operations and the disnix-soap-client to connect to it.

section.title: NixOS integration
section.para: Although Disnix manages the distributable components (services) of which a distributed system is composed and the inter-dependencies, Disnix does not manage the systtem configurations of the actual machines on which services are activated. This package contains additional tooling to manage NixOS system configurations of the machines in the network, and an extension to automatically create virtual machine instances from the network configuration for testing.
